intro: Microlicia caatingae, commonly known as the caatinga microlicia, is a shrub native to the semi-arid regions of northeastern Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small white flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in dry, nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
